Package org.jsfml.graphics

Class RenderWindow

java.lang.Object
org.jsfml.internal.SFMLNativeObject
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.core.SFMLNativeObject
org.jsfml.window.Window
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.window.BasicWindow
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.graphics.RenderWindow
All Implemented Interfaces:
RenderTarget, WindowStyle
Direct Known Subclasses:
Window
public class RenderWindow extends BasicWindow implements RenderTarget
Provides a window that can serve as a target for 2D drawing.

  • Field Summary

    • RenderWindow

      public RenderWindow(VideoMode mode, String title, int style, ContextSettings settings)
      Constructs a new render window and creates it with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      mode - the video mode to use for rendering.
      title - the window title.
      style - the window style.
      settings - the settings for the OpenGL context.
      See Also:
      • create(VideoMode, String, int, ContextSettings)

    • RenderWindow

      Parameters:
      mode - the video mode to use for rendering.
      title - the window title.
      style - the window style.
      See Also:
      • BasicWindow.create(VideoMode, String, int)

    • RenderWindow

      public RenderWindow(VideoMode mode, String title)
      Constructs a new render window and creates it with default style and context settings.
      Parameters:

      title - The window title.

    • create

      public void create(@NotNull @NotNull VideoMode mode, @NotNull @NotNull String title, int style, @NotNull @NotNull ContextSettings settings)
      Description copied from class: BasicWindow
      Creates and opens a window or re-creates it if it was already opened.
      Overrides:
      create in class BasicWindow
      Parameters:
      mode - the video mode that determines the window's size (must be a valid video mode in case WindowStyle.FULLSCREEN is set)
      title - the window title
      style - the style of the window
      settings - the context settings for the created OpenGL context.
      See Also:
      • VideoMode.isValid()
      • WindowStyle
      • ContextSettings

    • capture

      public Image capture()
      Copies the current contents of the window to an image.

      This is a slow operation and should be used to take screenshots, not to re-use resulting image as a texture. For that, use Texture.update(BasicWindow) or a RenderTexture instead.

      Returns:
      the image with the current contents of the window.
